Item.Name: Two Unique Collector Rockwell Plates VHTF
Item.Description: Two unique Norman Rockwell Plates, each measuring 8 1/2" in circumference . Ideal for collectors of hard to find Rockwell Plates . Cast in 1981, these plates are white with renditions of the actual oil paintings measuring 5" in circumference in the middle. The first plate is Rockwell's painting of " Artists Daughter ", a close depiction of Rockwell's own "Self-Portrait". This painting shows a small girl at an easel painting a picture of her small cherished doll.The background lighting of the picture is a soft amber glow, and the determination on the little girl's face is delightful. This is dated sixth in the series, 1981 The second plate is the painting titled " The Tinkerer ",showing an old man and his cat tinkering away on an old copper teapot, with a charming library background. This too is dated 1981 and is fifth in the series. Both plates are in mint condition with the exception of very small chips in the center rim of the back which are hard to see, and do not affect the front of the plate at all. The stamp on the back of "The Tinkerer" looks a bit askewed from when originally stamped. These make perfect Holiday gifts! Buyer to pay shipping and handling of 4.95. PayPal is the preferred payment and can ensure your gifts arrive in time for Christmas. I also accept money orders and cashiers checks. No personal checks please. Buyer to make contact within three days of auction closing, and payment to be received within 10 days of auction closing. United States residents only please. I apologize for the lack of pictures, but I felt they did not do the plates justice with the glare.

Item.Name: Carpet 2x3 Persian Hamadan Rug NR (#24383)
Item.Description: A.nounder {text-decoration:none;color:blue;font-weight:normal} A.nounder:hover {text-decoration:none;color:blue;font-weight:bold} A.nounder1 {text-decoration:none;color:navy;} A.nounder1:visited {text-decoration:none;color:navy;} A.nounder1:link {text-decoration:none;color:navy;} A.nounder1:hover {text-decoration:underline;color:blue;} _ Persian Rug Old 2x3 Hamadan NR (#24383) _ __ Click Photo to ZOOM!! See the details of this rug! __ __ __ _ _ Edonia Number: 24383 _ Design: Hamadan _ Country of Origin: Iran _ Material: 100% Wool _ Type: Hand-knotted _ Exact Size: 1'10" x 2'10" 22" x 34" 56cm x 86cm _ Condition: Good _ Age Category: Old _ Suggested Retail: $175 _ Shipping&Handling: $19 _ __ __ Click to learn more about Edonia Guides & Publications. _ Hamadan Rather than being the name of a particular design, Hamadan is actually the collection center serving some 700 villages in the area. The designs of this region are varied and are not used as a guide to the origin of the rug. Distinctive designs are associated with particular towns and villages such as Bibikabad, Ingelas, Dergezin, and Husianabad, all are generally referred to as Hamadans. Key characteristics are similarities in weave and colors. Almost all Hamadans are single wefted, a row of weft runs between each row of knots, using the Turkish/Symmetrical knot, with 40-100 knots per square inch. Most of the rugs of this region use similar strong, dark colors, including reds, blues, ivory and brown. Often they are woven mixing goat or camel hair mixed with wool or cotton. Designs are bold and geometric, incorporating many hexagonal and diamond-shaped designs including sharply angled medallions and zigzag patterns, which represent lightening. Stylized florals and utilization of the herati pattern are also quite common. Many older pieces, mostly runners, were woven on wool foundations with undyed camel hair and are therefore camel colored. Modern rugs have cotton foundations with stronger, darker colors, often with bright accent colors. It is now very rare to find them in the classic camel color. Hamadans are considered some of the best values in Persian rugs. _ Click HERE for answers to Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ). POINTS TO NOTE BEFORE BIDDING _ We strongly recommend you to zoom in on the pictures to see all details and the true colors. __ We greatly appreciate your feedback. We do not combine shipping. __ All items are shipped via UPS ground. Item.Name: New Mongoose Hydration Pack Camelbak
Item.Description: You are bidding on one brand new never used green Mongoose brand water pack (tag still attached). It is the backpack style no hands drinking system that is perfect for all sorts of sports or hiking. I use mine while motorcycling - allows me to drink on the fly without removing my helmet. It has a tube connected to the included water bladder that clips to your shirt or whatever you want to attach it to.You just drink from the tube (like a long straw). When you're done drinking, just close the valve on the end and it won't leak. The adjustable elastic straps on the front allows it to hold the bladder securely in its pack or they can even be used to carry a windbreaker with you (that's what I do). It has two fully adjustable shoulder straps that keeps the pack securely on your back as well as a strap that goes around your waist. Other features as identified by the tag: Holds 2 liters, Adjustable/padded waistbelt and External pockets for added storage.The pack also allows you to move the drink tube from the right side to the left side. Why pay the price they want for these at stores. Perfect for an X-mas gift. E-mail me with any questions you may have. Buyer to include $5.00 for shipping to anywhere in the continental US. I will ship within 1 business day of receiving payment. I accept Paypal, money orders or checks (I will wait for a check to clear before shipping). Thanx for looking!!! Free Honesty Counters powered by Andale! Item.Name: HALLMARK ORNAMENTs Book Set LE 25 Anniversary
Item.Description: This is a beautiful boxed set of two Hallmark Keepsake Ornaments Collector's Guides which were produced in a limited edition to commemorate the 25th anniversary. Item.Name: AIRCRAFT PERISCOPE SEXTANT KOLLSMAN W/ CASE
Item.Description: Periscopic aircraft sextant manufactured by the Kollsman Instrument Corp., MS 28011-5, REF. NO. 6605-00515-4834, MFR'S, STOCK NO. 6225-1471C-02, Honeywell repair tag dated April/18/89, REF NO.6605-00-515-4834. Now here is a very impressive and intricate navigational instrument! This is the periscopic sextant that was used by the USAF and CAF during the last 45 years. It was used on the B-47, B-52, C-54, C-97, C-118, C-119, C-121, C-124, KC-135, and other aircraft. It was used by the navigator or other crewmember to determine the altitude of a celestial body measured and recorded with reference to a bubble artificial horizon. A two power lens is incorporated into the periscope. Inertial and doppler navigation systems as well as GPS systems replaced the navigator and celestial navigation with this sextant. To illuminate the bubble and altitude counter a 28 volt D.C. aircraft supply was used. The sextant pictured below comes complete with a power connecting cable, spare light bulbs, and fiberglass storage case. It is in very good used condition, but sold as is. This is a fantastic gift for an aviation memorabilia collector, or former crew member on one of the above airplanes, so don't delay in your bidding. This is a nice sextant and it is hard to find a complete set with the case and the power cord. so bid before they are gone. Pls. check my feed-back on the condition of these equipment that I have already sold. I still have a few units left. Email me your question and I'll answer it the best I can . Item.Name: BATMAN DARK KNIGHT STRIKES AGAIN #2 Pre-Sell
Item.Description: BATMAN: THE DARK KNIGHT STRIKES AGAIN #2 First Printing. In 1986, a groundbreaking miniseries took the industry by storm, revolutionizing forever the way people envisioned the comic-book medium. Now acclaimed writer/artist Frank Miller is set to do it again, with the most anticipated comics sequel of all time... THE DARK KNIGHT STRIKES AGAIN. It's been three years since the events of THE DARK KNIGHT RETURNS, and everything is just fine. Perfect, in fact. At least on the surface. What the world at large doesn't know is that it's a total sham. A perfectly choreographed, pretty little world where everything that's ugly, or even potentially disturbing, is all nicely wrapped up with neat little ribbons and swept under the carpet. Only he knows better. He's watched it fester to near-breaking point, and it's time for the only free man left who can effect any real change to bring it all down around their ears, once and for all. It's not gonna be pretty. But at least it'll be honest. The Dark Knight returns once again -- trimmer, more streamlined, and with a vitality that hasn't been seen since the first years of his war on crime. Together with his army of Bat-soldiers, including Carrie Kelley -- formerly Robin, and now the new Catgirl -- the Dark Knight wages a new war on a diseased world that's become completely lost. But to fight this war successfully, he must first return to being the World's Greatest Detective and discover what has become of his former allies who were once the World's Greatest Heroes. THE DARK KNIGHT STRIKES AGAIN will be told in 3-parts -- each issue a whoppin' 80 pages in Prestige Format -- masterfully written and illustrated by Frank Miller and featuring the magnificent colors of Miller's collaborator, Lynn Varley. Published by DC Comics, 2002. Bagged & Boarded. We have over 25 years comic book experience and grade by Overstreet standards so bid with confidence. NOTE!!! This is a PRE-SELL auction in anticipation of the January 2002 release, and upon its reception will be shipped immediately to you. U.S./CDN buyer to include $3.00 US for SURFACE shipping or $4.00 US for AIR. International/Overseas buyer to include $4.00 US for SURFACE shipping or $7.00 US for AIR.**SEE ABOVE FOR PAYMENT REQUIREMENTS** MULTIPLE COPY SHIPPING RATES... 2 or 3 COPIES U.S./CDN buyer to include $5.00 US for SURFACE shipping or $6.50 US for AIR. Item.Name: 1954 Bing & Grondahl CHRISTMAS PLATE w/BOX
Item.Description: 1954 Bing & Grondahl Christmas Plate In Mint Condition! The Christmas Plate or "Juleplatte" stems from an ancient Danish Tradition, transformed into fine porcelain by Harald Bing in 1895._ Originally, the Christmas Plates were a gesture of thanks presented by Danish Nobility to their servants at Christmas time._ It was the thought of immortalizing this "gesture of thanks" in fine porcelain that has given the world a beautiful symbol of Christmas Spirit as well as the wonderful hobby of plate collecting, enjoyed by millions today.__ The Motif of this plate is " Birthplace of Hans Christian Andersen". Designed by Kjeld Bonfils. Size: 7" -_ 18 cm. Very Rare. No Reserve. Mint Condition. Buyer to pay $8.00 for domestic shipping and insurance (unlimited items). Item.Name: Vintage Graniteware Pitcher from Ireland
Item.Description: I purchased this graniteware / enamelware pitcher with a molded spout in Ireland. The pitcher is white and has gray trim around the rim and on the handle. The enamel is faded and dull and I believe the trim was probably black when it was new (probably many years ago). It appears to be very well made, but there is some rust primarily at the rim of the base, and the bottom - both inside and out. It measures approx. 7" in height; and approx. 6" in diameter at the base. There is no "maker marking" so I am uncertain as to age and origin. Looks great filled either with dried or fresh flowers - a great addition to any collection! Please see photos and email me if you have any questions, thanks!

Item.Name: Dept 56 Sleepy Hollow Buildings Set 5944-4 NR
Item.Description: Dept 56 Sleepy Hollow Buildings Set 5944-4 NR Auction ends Sunday! With immediate PayPal payment have it for Christmas! NO Reserve ~~~~~ MINT in Box ~~ Sleepy Hollow School ~~ Framed stone chimney warms log cabin school. Brick and wood belfry houses bell. Wood pile and bench with bucket near front door. School teacher Ichabod Crane Taught in this one-room schoolhouse ~~ Van Tassel Manor ~~ Yellow house with mansard roof with two front dormers. Wood corner posts support porch. Stone lean-to on one side. Double chimneys rise off roof ridge. Four ears of corn decorate front entry. After attending a party at the Van Tassel residence, Ichabod Crane set out for home but never got there ~~ Ichabod Crane's Cottage ~~ Stone first story topped by wood second story. Rough shingled roof with dip in the middle between two brick chimneys. This is the modest home provided for the village school master. New England Village Series Introduced in 1990 Retired in 1993 Original Retail Price $96.00 Excellent Condition Original Box & Sleeve also in Excellent Condition Pictures are of actual piece up for bid. Item.Name: Wind-up Walking Shot Glass - Too Cute!
Item.Description: Wind-up Walking Shot Glass - Too Cute! "Walking" might be too strong a term for what this shot glass actually does - "Burdened Waddling" would perhaps describe the action better. It does however manage to slowly maneuver (while wobbling from side to side) in a forward direction. I didn't try it "loaded with fuel" and I don't know how far you could expect him to go but judging from the brief tryout I doubt that you could expect more than a couple of feet on one winding. Even with these limitations it's a fun item. It's made from chromed plastic and has an on/off tab switch at the rear near the bottom. He was made in Japan - I don't know how old it is. Item.Name: TENYO Menta-Marvel T-158 in Original Package
Item.Description: TENYO Menta-Marvel T-158 in Original Packaging 5 DAY AUCTION In 1992, the effect which is considered by many to be one of Tenyo_s best, Suzuki_s Crystal Cleaver, was released. The same year, Tenyo also released the Menta-Marvel effect. However, unlike a majority of the Tenyo effects from the early 90s that are still in good supply, Menta-Marvel has become very difficult to find. Another interesting aspect of the Menta-Marvel effect is that it retailed for a bit more than other Tenyo items of its time_I believe I paid around $25 or $30 for this. Menta-Marvel was created by Yutaka Sato and is now a discontinued Tenyo item. For those of you not familiar with the Menta-Marvel effect, the back side of the packaging is shown in the picture below and gives a description of the effect. Supplied with the prediction board is a carrying case, a chinese crayon (if necessary, this can be replaced with a similar chinese crayon available at any office supply store), and also a cleverly-constructed set of ESP cards. The packaging has a few creases, the plastic _bubble_ has a couple small cracks and some dirt marks, however the apparatus appears to be in excellent condition. Here_s a chance to pick up what is possibly one of the most difficult post-_T-150_ Tenyo effects to find. If you have any questions about this trick, or if you_re having trouble viewing the images, please feel free to contact me through eBay_s _Ask Seller A Question_ feature. I welcome any questions, but please try to ask questions early, as I may not be able to respond to questions submitted shortly before the auction ends. Before bidding, please take a moment to check out the terms and conditions listed below the pictures. Finally, please note that this is a 5 day auction which will end this Sunday afternoon. Thanks for looking! TERMS AND CONDITIONS: I prefer payment through PayPal, however I also gladly accept payment by money order. No checks, cash, or COD requests please. Winning bidder in the US agrees to pay actual shipping cost of $4.35 for USPS Priority Mail shipping with delivery confirmation. Bidders outside of the US, please ask me for a shipping quote before bidding, and please include your postal code in the inquiry. I_ll contact the winning bidder by email within 24 hours of auction_s end. Winning bidder, please reply to my email as soon as possible. Thanks for checking out my auction. Good luck!

Item.Name: Vintage Barkcloth Drapes Scenic Garden 33x44
Item.Description: Vintage Barkcloth Drapes Scenic Garden 33x44 PAIR OF VINTAGE BARKCLOTH DRAPERY PANELS Scenic Garden Design Description: A magnificent set of pinch-pleated, lined drapery panels from an estate in Pennsylvania. Background is a soft shade of grey with a scenic garden design featuring green and grey leafed, as well as pink blossoming trees, garden statuary and columns. The colors feature several shades of grey, green, pink, with some white accenting. The design shown in the first picture is repeated randomly across the panels. Each panel of this pair measures 33" across the top edge, 67" across the bottom edge, and are 44" in length with a generous 6" hem. They are lined with an ivory fabric, which I believe is probably silk. They are a heavy weight, and are obviously quite well made. The lighting in the first picture shows them to be a bit darker than they actually are; the second photo shows more of the true coloring. Due to the width of the panels there is a lengthwise seam running down each panel. This pair of vintage barkcloth curtains is one of 2 pair of the same design and color that I am listing. U.S. Shipping Cost: $8.50 Please contact me for International Shipping Rates as they are slightly higher. Multiple purchases from my auctions can be combined to save on shipping costs. Condition: These drapes are in excellent condition. They have been well taken care of by the previous owners. There are no stains, holes, or worn spots that I can find. The colors are still bright. The ivory lining (which I believe is silk, but am not guaranteeing) has darked some from age, somewhat more noticeably so in the folds, but I see no evidence of water staining, etc. As with the barkcloth, the lining also does not have any noticeable holes or tears. Item.Name: RS-Awesome Ocean Jasper Sphere/Agate "eyes"
Item.Description: if (navigator.appName == 'Microsoft Internet Explorer') { if (navigator.appVersion.substring(0,1) "); } else { document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" BODY { background: url(http://therockshed.com/ebay/sand.jpg) }"); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); } } else { //Default to Netscape settings. document.write(" "); } RS-Awesome Ocean Jasper Sphere/Agate "eyes" This is a Beautiful Ocean Jasper Agate sphere. It measures 2 1/8" in diameter. It has pretty pink, white and green colors COVERED with little agate "eyes" that this material is known for. It has an Excellent polish and is fracture free. It has some small natural hollow areas between some of the eyes. An Excellent and Unusual Addition for any collection. This item will ship for $1.75 by first class mail. This material is a relatively new find from madagascar. The deposit formed as a rhyolite flow but has been completely silicified. The rhyolitic eyes or orbs come in an astonishing array of colors and color combinations. The background can be white, pink, green, red, or yellow. Botryoidal formations as well as white and deep green druzy are also common. This deposit has been discovered at the edge of the ocean. It can only be seen and collected at low tide. The area has no road so the material must be transported to civilization by boat. The seller said that he has been collecting for a long time. I am selling these cards 100 at a time because it is easier than selling them individually. Item.Name: OLD HALLMARK ORNAMENTS LOT
Item.Description: You are bidding on a lot of old hallmark ornaments, some of which are very hard to come by. The first ornament is from a collector's series. HARK! IT'S HERALD, it is dated 1991. It is of a very cute elf playing a flute. The second ornament is the STARDUST ANGEL, it is dated 1985. It is of a small angel dusting a star. A piece of the star is broken off, but otherwise it is in super condition. The next ornament is a minature and is the BRASS YEAR, it is dated 1990, and in fact, there are two of these ornaments. The next is the FRIENDSHIP TREE, it is dated 1991. It is a snow covered tree trunk with an owl and a squirrel exchanging presents and it even lights up. The next three ornaments are very special as they come from the collectors club. You cannot purchase these unless you belong to the Hallmark collectors club. The first is a minature ornament SITTING PURRTY, it is dated 1989. It is of a kitten in a mug that reads "collectors Club" and the kitten is wearing a Santa hat. The next is also a minature ornament and is called CROWN PRINCE, it is dated 1990. It is of a small bear wearing the Hallmark Gold Crown. The final ornament is a full size ornament and is also from the collector's club. WREATH OF MEMORIES is dated 1987. It is a handcrafted ormnament bearing the date and a few small items. All boxes are in good condition. Shipping will be priority mail at a cost of $5.00 and insurance will be available upon request. I accept billpoint, paypal and money orders. Buy now because a lot as old and valuable as this doesn't come around twice!!!!! Happy Holidays!

Item.Name: Betty Boop Red Shoes Salt Pepper Shakers NEW
Item.Description: Betty Boop Red Shoes Salt Pepper Shakers NEW Each of these fun shakers is approximately 2 1/2 inches tall by 3 1/2 inches wide. They are brightly red shoes with black heals. On the front of each shoe is Betty Boop's head. She is wearing gold earrings and matching necklace. On the top part of the shoes, where the inside sole would be it says in red lettering "Betty Boop". They are each brightly hand painted with a high gloss finish. They would make a great addition to any collection! We will start the bidding at $12.99 with no reserve. You can combine items from our other eBay auctions to save on shipping . Please check below if you have any questions. Shipping & Handling shipping and handling $4.50 Quoted shipping is for the USPS and is for items paid for by check or money order, items paid for on line, through paypal or other service, ship UPS only and shipping costs will be determined by destination Zip Code * Also any items that don't have shipping quoated on the ad will be quoted by Zip Code. SORRY NO INTERNATIONAL SALES . All shipping is calculated by weight, if your looking at more than one item and want an estimate on the shipping please email us with the item numbers and your zip code. All shipping quoted on this auction is for the lower 48 states, most of our items are light items and will not have problems shipping Priority Mail to Alaska and Hawaii for the prices quoted. Please note we only ship to the United States, APO's / FPO's and most US territories. Combining Items We are happy to combine items from our other ebay auctions so you can save on shipping. Some items due to their size can't be shipped together, this only applies to very large items, i.e. solar panels, large board games, golf carts, air filters, etc. may not be able to be combined because of their size or packaging. But nothing is set in stone, if we can find a box large enough we'll try anything. Contact us if you have any questions. To search or other auctions check out our Showcase at Auctiva. Bidding Per ebay "the winning bid is a binding contract to purchase the item". If you've bid and you know you can not complete the sale please cancel your bid. Please only bid if you intend to complete the transaction. Payment Our preferred form payment is by Money Order . California Shipments- must add 7.50% sales tax. Payments- are due within 14 days (2 weeks) from the close of the auction. If you are bidding on other items please let us know so we can track your order properly. * On Line Payments- to stay in compliance with the on line payment services and their on line tracking rules, items paid for by an on line payment services will ship UPS only to a physical address (NO PO Boxes). Shipping price will be determined by destination zip code , we ship from 92284, with the increases at the post office UPS shipping is usually comparable to the post office, especially if you add insurance and delivery confirmation to the post office fees which is free for UPS. Checks - will delay your order by 15 days from receipt of the monies. We use a different email address for on-line payments if you send the monies to the address registered with ebay it will not be claimed. Non payment- we file with ebay on all non completed auctions after 14 days have passed if payment has not been made per ebay rules you have an additional 10 days to make payment before it will affect your standing with ebay. If there is a problem and you can't make payment within this time Please email us so we can make some other arraignments with you. ebay's non paying bidder policy General Information. We will contact you at the close of the auction, usually within a few hours, with all the details to complete the transaction. If you don't hear from us within 24 hours there is probably a problem with your email, please contact us and make sure you can receive email from us at the address you have registered with ebay. When payment is received you will be emailed with your ship date. So as not to delay your order please include all your shipping information, name address, email address, and item numbers with payment. _1998-2001 AirGuy, www.FarWestGifts.com content of this ad is copyrighted, reproduction of text or photos is prohibited if you find our pictures or ad elsewhere please contact us. Item.Name: Benning & Condrey Drug Co. Bottle-Ft.Smith,AR
Item.Description: Benning - Condrey Drug Company Fort Smith, Ark Bottle Benning - Condrey Drug Company was in business for many years at 421 Garrison Avenue in Fort Smith, Arkansas. There were several drug companies in that part of town and visitors coming over the bridge from Oklahoma used to be greeted by a very large sign advertising laxatives...which made me wonder just what people thought of my hometown. Other than that I know nothing about this bottle. It is an unusual size I've been told, it is 2 and 7/16th inches wide by 7 and 1/4 inches tall. It has a measuring rule in the glass on either side, one is in CC's and the other I'm guessing is ounces and if I'm right this bottle held 8 ounces of something that I bet made you sleep real well at night......funny how the whiskey warehouses and the drug companies were side by side in old Fort Smith. The bottle is in good condition with a couple of little chips...the worst can be seen in the 3rd scan below. It comes with dirt and stains still inside from being buried for years. But the bottle would still hold 8 oz of Dr. Kick'em Up if you had a cork to keep the juice inside. The lettering is very sharp on this bottle and its a miracle it's still around. Arm yourselves, and be ye men of valour, and be in readiness for the conflict; for it is better for us to perish in battle than to look upon the outrage of our nation and our altar...... Winston Churchill May 19, 1940 View my other auctions Ruby Lane Antiques & Collectibles Payment Details See item description and Payment Instructions, or contact seller for more information. Item.Name: COMIC READER # 171 1979 THOR / EL AGUILA EXC!
Item.Description: if (navigator.appName == 'Microsoft Internet Explorer') { if (navigator.appVersion.substring(0,1) "); } else { document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); document.write(" BODY { background: url(http://home.iximd.com/~dealmakr/small-wh.jpg) }"); document.write(" "); document.write(" "); } } else { //Default to Netscape settings. document.write(" "); } VISA & MASTER CARD VIA PAYPAL ...................................CHEAP!...CHEAP!.......SHIPPING....LOOK BELOW COMIC READER # 171 1979 THOR / EL AGUILA EXC! Color front and back is outstanding...Front cover by Keith Pollard and Doug Herrings original version of Thor. Back cover Dave Cockrums original character model sheet of El Aguila. Comic is in Exc shape. No..binding dimples, binding corners are great..no paper loss.or bumping but just a pencil point size color loss on very tips. edges are sharp and clean . Opening corners ars Excellent. Front cover has a very light indentation from what looks to be where someone may have stacked another book on top of it in a of set direction. This is new and may flatten out with time..It is only on the cover page and does not go through. 62 pages long The pages in this are an off white..Now I think they may have been this color when printed..or close to a newspaper color..I say this becasue when you turn into the book there are some very white pages see the last 2 pics for the comparison...If they were all white to start with...They would all yellow at the same rate of time and be very close to the same color as each other..Its amazing that this held up as well as it did..Considering the fragile nature of the grade of paper used for the cover...It is not much above a newspaper stock..Not to mention how well the color held up. The art work front and back and the condition of it are amazing..I love the way it re-creates an old style look and feel. I do not think anyone will be dissapointed with this issue. I have 4 other Comic reader issues up for sale in the same condition from the same year...amongst other things..Please check my list CHECK MY ......ABOUT ME....PAGE FOR MY GRADING STANDARDS Any questions about any of the comics feel free to email me and ask. Shipping cost will be determined at the end of auction and will depend on where item is being shipped to. The farthest u.s. destination being the west coast usually runs about 13$ for 40 comics. Make sure to check out some of my singles up for sale. Might as well throw them in the box with these. Save $ on shipping. Pay by the pound...Why not........Thanks Click here to SEE MY OTHER COMICS UP FOR BID ATTENTION HIGH BIDDER: After winning bid you may send total plus shipping to: Lew Davis 404 Forehand Ct. Bel Air, MD 21015 If paying by Paypal : The Paypal user name is dealmakr@iximd.com. (USE LOWER CASE TEXT) Free counters provided by Honesty.com Click picture to see actual image size. Item.Name: LOOK Old Jewel Tea Cook Book NR
Item.Description: For auction is The Jewel Cook Book, Recipes for Good Eating (no date). The back cover says Mary Dunbar's Favorite Recipes. The inside front cover shows chocolate sweets and says "Chocolate-brown sweets for the man in the house..." Each category has advertisements on products Jewel Tea carried and the center has a colored picture of some products saying "Take the drudgery out of housework by using Jewel's cleaning aids." I remember the Jewel Tea man coming to our house when I was a Kid (now I'm telling my age) This book has 62 pages. It is 5 1/2" x 8". It has no missing pages and is not coming apart. As you can tell by the pic's it must have been used as it has some foxing. I like the recipe for Fried Spring Chicken. I wonder when we quit using the term "Spring Chicken"? Also, with this is a Silverware coupon from Jewel Tea Co which expired on Dec. 31, 1951. THANKS FOR LOOKING AND GOOD LUCK BIDDING. No reserve.
